This User Guide corresponds to PMB version 2.2

sect1.title: About PMB
sect1.para: PMB is a completely free ILS (Integrated Library management System). For more details refer to www.sigb.net .

sect1.title: How is the OPAC organized
sect1.para: OPAC stands for Online Public Access Catalogue.
The OPAC of PMB enables the library user to query the catalogue on the holdings of the library, that is , to make searches. You have various search modes at your disposal :

listitem.para: exploring the color wheel or the 100 knowledge tables (for schools)

sect1.para: The OPAC screen is divided in two parts :

listitem.para: a side strip showing reader's login
the central interface which contains the search form and eventually search results, catalogue browsing options
